root.name: return
root.description: Keyword used to indicate the value to return from a function. The value being returned must be the same datatype as defined in the function declaration. Functions declared with void can't return values and shouldn't include a return value. The keyword return may also be used to break out of a function thus not allowing the program to read the remaining statements (see the third example above).

parameter.label: type
parameter.description: boolean, byte, char, int, float, String, boolean[], byte[], char[], int[], float[], String[]

parameter.label: function
parameter.description: a function that is being defined

parameter.label: value
parameter.description: must be the same datatype as the type parameter
